description: Facebook Live is a fun and powerful way to connect with your followers by creating rich stories on Facebook in real time. The Live API allows you to create stories on Facebook using live video content from a variety of sources.

blocks.name: getLiveVideo
blocks.description: Allows to get information about live video.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Your accessToken obtained from Facebook.

args.name: liveVideoId
args.info: Required: The ID of the live video.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Your accessToken obtained from Facebook.

args.name: edge
args.info: Required: valid liveVideoId.

args.name: contentTags
args.info: Optional: Tags that describe the contents of the video. Use search endpoint with type=adinterest to get possible IDs.

args.name: description
args.info: Optional: The description of the live video.

args.name: isAudioOnly
args.info: Optional: Flag to indicate that the broadcast is audio-only andhas no video stream.

args.name: plannedStartTime
args.info: Optional: Unix timestamp when the broadcaster plans to go live.

args.name: privacy
args.info: Optional: Privacy for this live video.

args.name: published
args.info: Optional: Set this to false to preview the stream before going live. Deprecated. Prefer setting the status instead.

args.name: saveVod
args.info: Optional: Whether or not the video data should be saved for later consumption in VOD format. Default is true, except for certain broadcasts types (e.g. AMBIENT)

args.name: status
args.info: Optional: Choose between UNPUBLISHED or LIVE_NOW.

args.name: stopOnDeleteStream
args.info: Optional: Default value: true. Set this to true if stream should be stopped when deleteStream RTMP command received.

args.name: streamType
args.info: Optional: The type of stream. Default value: REGULAR. Use AMBIENT for continuous broadcasts that last days or weeks (like panda cams). Ambient broadcasts do not generate VOD or notifications.

args.name: targeting
args.info: Optional: Object and looks like only for page_id edge that limits the audience for this content. Anyone not in these demographics will not be able to view this content.

args.name: title
args.info: Optional: The title of the live video.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Your accessToken obtained from Facebook.

args.name: liveVideoId
args.info: Required: valid liveVideoId.

args.name: contentTags
args.info: Optional: Tags that describe the contents of the video. Use search endpoint with type=adinterest to get possible IDs.

args.name: copyrightsViolationDialogState
args.info: Optional: Broadcaster-FB dialog regarding copyrights violation found, if any.

args.name: description
args.info: Optional: The description of the live video.

args.name: disturbing
args.info: Optional: If true, autoplay will be disabled and live video will have a graphic content warning overlay.

args.name: embeddable
args.info: Optional: If true, live video will be embeddable.

args.name: endLiveVideo
args.info: Optional: If true, the live video will be ended. Only valid if the live video is still running.

args.name: isAudioOnly
args.info: Optional: Flag to indicate that the broadcast is audio-only andhas no video stream.

args.name: place
args.info: Optional: Location associated with the video, if any.

args.name: privacy
args.info: Optional: Privacy for this live video.

args.name: published
args.info: Optional: Set this to false to preview the stream before going live. Deprecated. Prefer setting the status instead.

args.name: sponsorId
args.info: Optional: Facebook Page id that is tagged as sponsor in the video post.

args.name: status
args.info: Optional: Choose between UNPUBLISHED or LIVE_NOW.

args.name: streamType
args.info: Optional: The type of stream. Default value: REGULAR. Use AMBIENT for continuous broadcasts that last days or weeks (like panda cams). Ambient broadcasts do not generate VOD or notifications.

args.name: tags
args.info: Optional: Users tagged in the live video.

args.name: targeting
args.info: Optional: Object and looks like only for page_id edge that limits the audience for this content. Anyone not in these demographics will not be able to view this content.

args.name: title
args.info: Optional: The title of the live video.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Your accessToken obtained from Facebook.

args.name: liveVideoId
args.info: Required: valid liveVideoId.

blocks.name: getLiveVideoLikes
blocks.description: Allows to retrive likes for live video.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Your accessToken obtained from Facebook.

args.name: liveVideoId
args.info: Required: valid liveVideoId.

blocks.name: getLiveVideoComments
blocks.description: Allows to retrive comments for live video.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Your accessToken obtained from Facebook.

args.name: liveVideoId
args.info: Required: valid liveVideoId.

args.name: filter
args.info: Optional: Default value: toplevelfilter.

args.name: liveFilter
args.info: Optional: Default value: filter_low_quality. For comments on a Live streaming video, this determines whether low quality comments will be filtered out of the results (filtering is enabled by default). In all other circumstances this parameter is ignored.

args.name: order
args.info: Optional: Preferred ordering of the comments. Accepts chronological (oldest first) and reverse chronological (newest first). If the comments can be ranked, then the order will always be ranked regardless of this modifier.

blocks.name: getLiveVideoErrors
blocks.description: Allows to retrive errors for live video.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Your accessToken obtained from Facebook.

args.name: liveVideoId
args.info: Required: valid liveVideoId.

blocks.name: getLiveVideoReactions
blocks.description: Allows to retrive reactions for live video.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Your accessToken obtained from Facebook.

args.name: liveVideoId
args.info: Required: valid liveVideoId.

args.name: type
args.info: Optional: Reaction type. Avaliable values: NONE, LIKE, LOVE, WOW, HAHA, SAD, ANGRY, THANKFUL.
